page.title: 04THE WASTE PAPER FACTORY
page.content: There is a waste paper factory in Baltonsborough. It started in 1951 with an output of 10 tonnes per week. Now the output is 200 tonnes which saves 3,400 trees a week.The area of the factory is 1.5 acres. Waste paper comes from all over the West Country. It comes mainly from banks, businesses and computers.The waste is mainly clean or printed and is sorted into different compartments and then baled. A bale weighs half a tonne. Twenty tonnes are loaded onto a lorry. There is about Â£40 profit for 1 tonne of top quality paper.The price varies on quality from Â£45_Â£250.The factory handles approximately 40 out of 100 different grades of paper. 17 workers are employed. Villagers complain about the state of the roads left by heavy lorries, but these are not all from waste paper lorries.
